title: How have hip fracture readmissions within 28 days changed over time?
analysis_commentary: The chart shows the total annual readmissions for hip fracture within 28 days, along with age- and sex-standardised hip fracture readmission rates per 1,000 population. There were a total of 49,469 readmissions within 28 days of discharge from hospital following hip fracture during the study. Overall the number of readmissions increased by 68.9%, rising from 3,658 in 2001/02 to 6,180 in 2010/11. The crude readmission rate over the 10-year period was 9.7%. Figure 1.6 summarises the change in age- and sex-standardised readmission rates after hip fracture. In contrast to mortality rates, the 28-day readmission rate increased dramatically, rising from 80.3 per 1,000 admissions in 2001/02 to 113.4 per 1,000 admissions in 2010/11, an overall increase of 41.3% over 10 years.
